data.title: “Svengoolie” presents his big broadcast premiere of “The Creation of the Humanoids” (1962), this Sat. on Me-TV
data.meta_description: Fellow Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere will be jumping for joy for his upcoming big broadcast premiere of a cult classic sci-fi/thriller masterpiece. “Svengoolie” presents his big broadcast premiere of “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aCD4aOgHH04 Original 1962 theatrical trailer for Wesley Barry’s “Creation of the Humanoids.” Sidebar: Due to the source material of the footage for…
data.text:
Fellow Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere will be jumping for joy for his upcoming big broadcast premiere of a cult classic sci-fi/thriller masterpiece.

“Svengoolie” presents his big broadcast premiere of “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962)

Original 1962 theatrical trailer for Wesley Barry’s “Creation of the Humanoids.” Sidebar: Due to the source material of the footage for the original theatrical trailer, you may have to turn up your volume. –C.H.

The legendary Berwyn/Chicago-based sci-fi feature film host will present his big broadcast premiere of “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962), this Sat.; July 31 at 8 p.m. Eastern/7 p.m. Central on Me-TV.

The 1962 cult classic sci-fi masterpiece production was directed by actor-turned-veteran director Wesley Barry. Barry started his motion picture career as a child actor at the age of seven when a talent scout from the Kalem Company, one of the pioneering film studios; spotted young Barry. One of his earliest credited feature film appearance was in the role of Mrs. Mum’s son Chance E. Ward’s Kalem comedy production of “The Phoney Cannibal” (1915) with comedians Lloyd “Ham” Hamilton and “Bud” Duncan. Barry would later direct numerous feature films and TV shows throughout the majority of his motion picture and TV production career as an assistant director.

Alongside “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962), some of Barry’s productions that he worked as an assistant director on included William Beaudine’s Monogram (the future Allied Artists) production of “Tuna Clipper” (1949)* with Roddy McDowall, Elena Verdugo and Roland Winters; Beaudine’s classic mammoth Monogram “Bowery Boys” spook-comedy masterpiece with Leo Gorcey, Huntz Hall, Lloyd Corrigan, Lela Bliss and Bernard Gorcey; “Ghost Chasers” (1951); 15 episodes of Jack Wrather’s classic “Lassie” mammoth masterpiece TV series (1962-64), Roger Corman’s classic mammoth Twentieth Century Fox (Twentieth Century Studios) action-historical drama masterpiece with Jason Robards, George Segal, Jean Hale, Ralph Meeker, John Agar, Joseph Campanella and young Bruce Dern; “The St. Valentine’s Day Massacre” (1967). One of Barry’s final productions as an assistant director was for Aaron Spelling & Leonard Goldberg’s classic ABC television action-drama masterpiece series, “The Rookies” (Barry worked on 14 episodes of the Spelling-Goldberg series from 1972-75).

Barry also co-produced “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) with veteran Monogram/Allied Artists feature film music composer Edward J. Kay. The screenplay for Barry’s 1962 cult classic sci-fi masterpiece entry was written by veteran screenwriter Jay Simms, who also wrote the screenplay adaptation with Jay Simms for the Ken Curtis (of TV’s “Gunsmoke” fame)-Ray Kellogg cult classic sci-fi/creature masterpiece production for radio station owner Gordon McLendon’s firm, “The Giant Gila Monster” (1959, which was one of McLendon’s few motion picture productions). Simms’ screenplay for “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) was adapted from Jack Williamson’s novel of the same name.

“Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) was produced by Genie Productions and was released theatrically through independent distribution firm Emerson Film Enterprises, according to IMDB. Emerson Film Enterprises is best known to many “Mystery Science Theater 3000”/MST3K MSTies as the original theatrical distributor for Harold P. Warren’s cult horror production of “Manos: The Hands of Fate” (1966); “Manos” was famously riffed on MST3K on Comedy Central back in 1993 with original series host/creator Joel Hodgson (as Joel Robinson), Trace Beaulieu (as Mad scientist Dr. Clayton Forester/the vocal stylings of Crow T. Robot), Frank Conniff (as Mad scientist TV’s Frank) and Kevin Murphy (the vocal stylings of Tom Servo) in ep. #424, according to the MST3K Info Guide site/Satellite News.

Who was in “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962)?

The players who appeared in Wesley Barry’s cult classic sci-fi masterpiece production of “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) were Don Megowan (as Capt. Kenneth Cragis), Erica Elliott (as Maxine Megan), Frances McCann (as Esme Cragis Milos), Don Doolittle (as Dr. Raven), David Cross (as Pax), Richard Vath (as Mark), Reid Hammond (as Hart), Malcolm Smith (as Court), George Milan (as Acto), Dudley Manlove (as Lagan), Pat Bradley (in an uncredited role as Dr. Moffitt) and Gil Frye (in an uncredited role as Orus).

In addition to his numerous film and TV roles throughout his acting career, Don Megowan was best known for his role of the Gill-Man creature/monster for land sequences in John Sherwood’s classic mammoth Universal Studios “Gill- Man”/”Creature From the Black Lagoon” monster masterpiece with Ricou Browning, Leigh Snowden, Rex Reason and Gregg Palmer; “The Creature Walks Among Us” (1956, the final feature in Universal’s classic mammoth “Creature”/”Gill-Man” monster masterpiece trilogy series). Megowan also appeared in the role of Sheriff Jack Haines in the classic mammoth Fred F. Sears–Sam Katzman–Columbia Pictures werewolf monster masterpiece production of “The Werewolf” (1956), with Steven Ritch, Joyce Holden, Kim Charney and George Cisar; Megowan later appeared in the role of a gum chewer in Mel Brooks’ classic mammoth Warner Bros. comedy-western masterpiece production with Cleavon Little, Gene Wilder, Harvey Korman, Madeline Kahn, Alex Karras, jazz legend Count Basie, Slim Pickens and Dom DeLuise; “Blazing Saddles” (1974). Alongside “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) in her brief acting career, Erica Elliott also appeared in the role of Laura Barclay in an episode of Blake Edwards’ classic mammoth detective masterpiece series, “Peter Gunn” (in the 1961 episode, “Deadly Intrusion”) with Craig Stevens, Lola Albright and Herschel Bernardi and the role of Mrs. Brown’s friend in Jack Arnold’s classic mammoth Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) comedy masterpiece with Bob Hope, Lana Turner, Agnes Moorehead, Jim Hutton, Paula Prentiss, Janis Paige and Don Porter; “Bachelor In Paradise” (1962).

Dudley Manlove previously appeared in the role of Eros in Ed Wood/Edward D. Wood Jr.’s cult classic low-budget sci-fi production with silver screen horror/monster film legend Bela Lugosi, pioneering legendary Los Angeles TV classic horror film host Malia “Vampira” Nurmi, professional wrestler Tor Johnson and fortune teller (?)Criswell, “Plan 9 From Outer Space” (1957). During her brief acting career, Frances McCann previously appeared in a role as an actress on an episode of Jerry Colonna’s short-lived comedy series, “The Jerry Colonna Show.” According to the American Film Institute, McCann also appeared as part of the festivities for the original theatrical premiere of “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) in Los Angeles, California.

“Creation of the Humanoids” (1962): Inspiration for Wesley Barry’s Genie Productions

According to the June 1962 edition of Boxoffice Magazine, the name of Wesley Barry’s production firm that produced “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962); Genie Productions was inspired by one of Barry’s other film productions that was produced by his company in the same year. Barry’s other production, the live-action/animated family short subject featurette; “The Jolly Genie” (1962) served as the inspiration for the name of Barry’s production firm. Both “Creation of the Humanoids” and “The Jolly Genie” were released theatrically through Emerson Film Enterprises.

Wesley Barry’s “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962): Alien make-up effects from one of cinema’s legendary veteran monster and creature make-up artists

Wesley Barry’s cult classic production of “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) had the distinction of having the actors’ alien make-up effects created by one of cinema’s legendary make-up artists who specialized in pioneering make-up techniques for distinctive classic mammoth monster and horror feature film masterpieces earlier in his film career. According to IMDB, legendary veteran feature film monster/horror feature film make-up artist Jack Pierce worked on the make-up effects for the alien creatures in the film.

Pierce was best-known for his past monster/creature make-up creations for Universal Studios’ classic mammoth monster masterpiece productions; including Bela Lugosi in Tod Browning’s adaptation of Bram Stoker’s “Dracula” (1931), Boris Karloff in James Whale’s adaptation of Mary Shelley’s “Frankenstein” (1931), Karloff in Karl Freund’s “The Mummy” (1932), Claude Rains in James Whale’s adaptation of H.G. Wells’ “The Invisible Man” (1933), Elsa Lanchester and Boris Karloff in James Whale’s “Bride of Frankenstein” (1935), Lon Chaney Jr. in George Waggner’s “The Wolf Man” (1941) and Claude Rains in Arthur Lubin’s Technicolor adaptation of “Phantom of the Opera” (1943). Pierce’s career at Universal ended in 1947 due in part to the studio’s merger with International Pictures (as “Universal-International”); Pierce freelanced for other production firms for the remainder of his career, according to the Universal retrospective featurette on the life and career of Jack Pierce, “He Who Made Monsters: The Life and Art of Jack Pierce” (2008).

To promote the screening for “Creation of the Humanoids” in Los Angeles, California; Pierce decided to apply the “humanoid” alien creature make-up effects to veteran Los Angeles broadcast announcer and host of KHJ-TV (today’s KCAL-TV) and the station’s “Million Dollar Movie,” Wayne Thomas; according to additional details from IMDB and Monsters From The Vault.

“Creation of the Humanoids” (1962): Released as a double-feature presentation with another Emerson-distributed feature

According to the American Film Institute’s database entry article on “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962), Wesley Barry’s cult classic sci-fi masterpiece production was released as a double-feature presentation with another Emerson-distributed feature film release. The other film in the aforementioned 1962 Emerson sci-fi/horror double-feature theatrical release presentation was Virgil W. Vogel and Jerry Warren’s dubbed version of the Swedish cult classic sci-fi thriller masterpiece, “Invasion of the Animal People” (1962) with the vocal stylings of John Carradine for Vogel and Warren’s dubbed edition, Barbara Wilson, Sten Gester, Robert Burton, Gösta Prüzelius and Ake Grönberg.

Be sure to watch Svengoolie’s big broadcast premiere of “The Creation of the Humanoids” (1962), this Sat. on Me-TV!

With Don Megowan, Erica Elliott, Frances McCann, Don Doolittle, David Cross, Richard Vath, Reid Hammond, Malcolm Smith, George Milan, Dudley Manlove, Pat Bradley Gil Frye, the alien make-up effects of Jack Pierce and the cinematography of veteran Hollywood cinematographer Hal Mohr; you will not want to miss out on Svengoolie’s big broadcast premiere of Wesley Barry’s “The Creation of the Humanoids” (1962), this Sat. on Me-TV! Escape from anxiety and stress with the magic and fun of Sven’s big broadcasts with Sven’s extended fun facts, Sven and Doug’s evening parody song, Sven and Kerwyn’s “safety” mail call segment and much, much more! You will not be disappointed! Highly recommended to all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals and all fellow super sci-fi feature film aficionados everywhere!

*”Tuna Clipper” (1949) is not connected to the legendary co-host of Me-TV’s legendary weekday morning “Toon In With Me” classic cartoon masterpiece showcase, Toony the Tuna! –C.H.

“Svengoolie” presents his big broadcast premiere of “Creation of the Humanoids” (1962)

Sat., July 31 at 8 p.m. Eastern/7 p.m. Central on Me-TV (part of “Super Sci-Fi Sat. Night”)

In the Frederick, Maryland/Washington, D.C. area: WTTG-5.3/Cable 196/FiOS 489/Antietam Broadband 194 (also on QAM digital 68.6 for Antietam subscribers)

In the Baltimore, Maryland area: WBAL-TV 11.2/Cable 208/FiOS 460

In the Hanover/Gettysburg/York, Pennsylvania area: WGAL-TV 8.2/Cable 248/FiOS 460

Join in by having fun and live-tweeting with all of us fellow super SvenPals everywhere on the live-tweeting airlanes of Twitter this Sat., July 31 during #Svengoolie’s big broadcast of premiere of Wesley Barry’s “The Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) on Me-TV this Sat.!

To all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals/fellow readers/fellow subscribers of “Silver Screen Reflections” everywhere: Seriously, Please be good, kind, courteous, safe and respectful to each other. Let’s all look to positive/uplifting enlightenment, wisdom and encouragement from Svengoolie, all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere, all fellow super Me-TV “Toon In With Me”/”Saturday Morning Cartoons” Tooners, all fellow super Mystery Science Theater 3000/MST3K MSTies everywhere and all fellow super classic film/television aficionados everywhere. Again, to all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals and all fellow super Me-TV “Toon In With Me”/”Saturday Morning Cartoons” Tooners, fellow super MST3K MSTies & fellow super classic film & TV aficionados everywhere; safety first, to our fellow super SvenPals/MSTies/Tooners who have not made a plan to get their vaccines yet, be sure schedule your vaccines by contacting your doctor/physician/healthcare professional soon, follow all precautions safely and seriously, wear a protective face mask/appropriate protective face covering, wash your hands for approximately 20 sec., avoid touching your face, practice proper social distancing/physical distancing protocols, use a tissue/sleeve when coughing/sneezing, stay home, keep healthy and stay well. Again, let’s all take preventative measures/steps by being safe, keeping healthy and staying well- and again, we fellow super SvenPals everywhere highly recommend watching Kerwyn’s informative coronavirus/COVID-19 prevention safety public service announcement! Escape from anxiety, chaos and stress by relaxing and having fun with Sven and his Sat. evening big broadcasts of classic creature/sci-fi/monster/horror/fantasy feature film masterpieces on Me-TV’s big broadcast airlanes & Sven’s big broadcast premiere of Wesley Barry’s “The Creation of the Humanoids” (1962) this Sat. on Me-TV! Join in on the fun with all fellow super SvenPals everywhere by live-tweeting on the Twitter airlanes during Sven’s Sat. evening big broadcasts! Again, be good, safety first, keep healthy and stay well, Sven/Mr. Rich Koz, the entire Sven/Me-TV production team & the entire crowd of fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere! To quote Svengoolie’s executive producer, Jim Roche: “#KeepCalmAndWatchSven!” –C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! This Sat.! Sven returns on the road for his big “On the Road” comeback & the big return of “Flashback Weekend!” Credit to fellow super Svengoolie SvenPal Kat from Flashback Weekend for spreading the word about this! Fellow Berwyn/Chicago super Svengoolie SvenPals and fellow coast-to-coast super Svengoolie SvenPals are all jumping for joy for Svengoolie/Rich Koz’s comeback on the road, his comeback for Chicago’s “Flashback Weekend” and on the convention circuit for the upcoming 2021 “Flashback Weekend” Chicago Horror Convention at the Hyatt Regency O’Hare Hotel in Rosemont, Illinois (9300 W. Bryn Mawr Ave., Rosemont, Illinois; 60018) this upcoming Sat., July 31! Sven/Rich’s “Flashback Weekend” 2021 appearance scehdule on Sat., July 31 will contain Celebrity photo-ops at 1:30 p.m. (local time, sidebar- for the Celebrity photo-op session, each professional 8×10 Sven photo-op photo is $30 per person/attendee, no more than two fans per photo and you cannot take your own photo/video in the photo-op room according to the official FAQ page for Flashback Weekend) the professional photo-op photos will be signed by Sven, followed by an autograph and table photo session from 2:30-3:30 p.m. (local time) and concluding with Sven/Rich hosting the “Sinister Visions Costume Contest” from 4:15 p.m.-5:00 p.m. (local time)! Ticket pricing and additional information is available through the official Flashback Weekend convention website. ***Seriously, please follow all health/safety regulations/social distancing protocols/measures & precautions in terms of the ongoing COVID-19/coronavirus pandemic, according to the official Flashback Weekend rules- all attendees must wear a proper safety/face mask for all events at the festival and COVID-19 regulations/rules will be in place for the entire event according to official Flashback Weekend website***.

To Sven/Rich, Kat, Flashback Weekend guests & fellow super SvenPals of Berwyn/Chicago/Rosemont, Illinois and coast-to-coast who are traveling to the big return of the Flashback Weekend convention this Sat., we hope you have a safe, wonderful & fun time during the return of the Flashback Weekend horror convention! On a serious note- again, to all guests/personalities for the “Flashback Weekend” horror convention in terms of the ongoing coronavirus/COVID-19 please follow all health & safety protocols/precautions/rules seriously during the events at the “Flashback Weekend” horror convention. –C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Be sure to watch/record and experience your favorite classic cartoon masterpieces with Bill Leff/Bill the Cartoon Curator, Toony the Tuna, Goldie Fisher, Boxcar, Soundra, Dippy, Sue P. from Sales, Lorna Greene, Pop Quizzer and Mr. Quizzer’s weekday morning classic cartoon masterpiece showcase on Me-TV, “Toon In With Me!” Featuring many classic cartoon masterpieces and classic cartoon masterpiece rarities, including Warner Bros.’ “Merrie Melodies” & “Looney Tunes” classic cartoon masterpieces (counting both pre-1948 WB and post-1948 WB cartoons), the Warner Bros./Turner Entertainment collection of the classic Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) “Tom & Jerry,” “Droopy” & Tex Avery classic cartoon masterpieces & the Warners-Turner collection of the classic Max & Dave Fleischer/Famous Studios/Paramount “Popeye” cartoon masterpieces & the classic Max Fleischer/Paramount “Betty Boop” cartoon masterpieces transferred from U.M.&M./National Telefilm Associates (NTA) TV syndication prints & vithe classic DePatie-Freleng/Mirisch/United Artists “Pink Panther,” “The Inspector” and “Roland and Rattfink” classic cartoon masterpieces via MGM/UA weekday mornings at 7 a.m. Eastern/6 a.m. Central on most Me-TV stations! And for more classic cartoon masterpiece fun, Me-TV’s “Saturday Morning Cartoons” showcase consists of three-hour blocks withthe classic DePatie-Freleng/Mirisch/UA “Pink Panther”/”The Inspector”/”Roland and Rattfink” cartoon masterpieces paired with the classic Max & Dave Fleischer/Famous Studios/Paramount “Popeye” cartoon masterpieces plus Max Fleischer’s classic Paramount “Betty Boop” cartoon masterpieces (again, the majority of the Betty Boop cartoons are sourced from older UM&M/National Telefilm Associates TV syndication prints), the classic Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) “Tom & Jerry” cartoon masterpieces plus Tex Avery’s classic MGM cartoon masterpieces, several rarely-seen classic MGM cartoon masterpieces and the classic Warner Bros. “Merrie Melodies” & “Looney Tunes” classic cartoon masterpieces; Sat. mornings from 7 a.m.-10 a.m. Eastern/6 a.m.-9 a.m. Eastern on most Me-TV stations! Wake up and watch early in the morning or record for later viewing of your favorite classic cartoon masterpieces with the magic and fun of Bill Leff/Bill the Cartoon Curator, Toony the Tuna, Goldie Fisher, Boxcar, Dippy, Sue P. from Sales, Pop Quizzer and Mr. Quizzer weekday mornings and the Sat. Me-TV classic cartoon masterpiece festival! And again, to Me-TV’s Toony & Kerwyn- again, please be good to each other! –C.H.

Good news, fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners! I will join all of you on Thurs. morning, July 29 (the fourth anniversary of my Sven/Hood College cameo graduation photo appearance) for the live-tweeting of Toony, R.H. Stepchild & Bill Leff/Bill the Cartoon Curator’s big “Toon In With Me” safety broadcast of ep. #138 on the airlanes of Me-TV! Be good, safety first/stay safe, keep healthy &stay well, fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners everywhere! –C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! New supplies available by popular demand and available for purchase on the official Me-TV Sven & “Toon In WIth Me” online store site! The official Svengoolie hat in the official Sven/”Toon In”/Me-TV online store site! And the official “Toony & Donuts” tee & the official brand-new official “Toony & Donuts” mug! Many fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners have already purchased their official “Toony & Donuts” mug and/or tee! Again, be sure to purchase your official Toony & Donuts tee and/or mug! Sale ends soon! Finish your holiday shopping early! Plus official Sven apparel, the offical “Toony” tee, official Sven mugs, official Toony/Bill Leff & Toony mugs, additional varieties of Sven hats, the Sven “It Came From Berwyn” poster, Sven magnets, Sven smartphone cases (for Apple’s iPhone and select Samsung smartphone devices), the Sven action figure and much, much more! One of many wonderful gifts for any occasion! And again, to quote the official rule of the official Sven, “Toon In” and Me-TV online store site, “no personal checks!” And only purchase authentic/official Sven/”Toon In” items! –C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Cameo mentions of fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals/fellow super “Toon In With Me” Tooners!

Extra! Extra! Extra! (At the 0:42 mark)! Fellow super #Svengoolie SvenPals & fellow super “#ToonInWithMe” #Tooners everywhere jumped for joy on Mon. morning, July 26 when my cameo Toony photo appearance was showcaed in ep. #139 for the “mail call” segment in Toony & Bill’s big “Toon In” broadcast on Me-TV! My “Toony & mini-Donut” photo was photograped for “#NationalDonutDay” back in June! In commemoration of Toony’s favorite food of Donuts and “National Donut Day” back in June, I decided to make “mini-Donuts” with my parents’ vintage “Donut Bakery” Donut maker! Toony, Sue Thsayer, Bill Leff/Bill the Cartoon Curator & all my fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners were all doing the dance of joy for my “Toony & mini-Donut” cameo photo in Toony, Sue & Bill’s July 28, 2021 “mail call” segment for their big broadcast of “Toon In With Me” ep. #139! Be sure to hear their praise for my “Toony & mini-Donut” cameo! A big, big thank you to Toony the Tuna, Goldie Fisher, Bill Leff/Bill the Cartoon Curator, Sue Thsayer & Mr. Quizzer for showcasing my cameo “Toony & mini-Donut” photo in ep. #139 of “Toon In With Me!” Plus, I put all my fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners’ congratulatory tweets in connection to my “Toony & mini-Donut” “Toon In” cameo photo appearance as a “Twitter Moments” post!

A big, big thank you to all my fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners for the wonderful congratulatory greetings on the Twitter airlanes for my cameo “Toony & mini-Donut” in ep. 139 of “Toon In With Me” in Toony, Sue Thsayer & Bill’s “mail call” segment! I highly appreciate all the congratulatory greetings! Very awesome, neat & cool! We’re all jumping for joy! Three cheers, two thumbs up, keep up the wonderful & excellent work, stay safe, keep healthy, stay well, peace, “Hi-Keeba” and a big, big toast to Toony the Tuna, Goldie Fisher, Bill Leff/Bill the Cartoon Curator, Sue Thsayer, Mr. Quizzer & all my fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere & all my fellow super “Toon In with Me” Tooners everywhere! -C.H.

Fourth anniversary flashback: Svengoolie (portrayed by Rich Koz) and Kerwyn’s “mail call” from Svengoolie’s July 29, 2017 big broadcast of the classic Universal “Inner Sanctum” mystery masterpiece, “Calling Dr. Death” (1943); segment recorded by fellow super Svengoolie SvenPal Fritz Freakenstein!

Extra! Extra! Extra! Wait! There’s more! The fourth anniversary of my cameo Svengoolie/Hood College graduation photo/Sven-Kerwyn ”mail call” appearance! Nearly four years ago: On the evening of Sat., July 29, 2017; fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere jumped for joy during my “official chicken thrower” Sven T-shirt cameo appearance on Sven and Kerwyn’s “mail call” segment for the Universal/Lon Chaney Jr. “Inner Sanctum” mystery, “Calling Dr. Death” (1943) on Me-TV! Again, a big, bit thank you to all my fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals from coast-to-coast for all the wonderful congratulatory greetings for my Sven/”Hood College” 2017 graduation photo! And again, a big, big thank you to Sven and Kerwyn for showing my Hood College/”official chicken thrower” Sven T-shirt grad. photo appearance back on July 29, 2017! Three cheers, two thumbs up, keep up the wonderful & excellent work, stay safe, stay well, keep healthy, peace, kudos & “Hi-Keeba” and a big, big toast to Sven, Kerwyn and all my fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals/fellow super “Toon In With Me” Tooners everywhere! -C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals & fellow super “ToonInWithMe” Tooners everywhere jumped for joy when one of our fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners recently showcased her recent photo masterpieces with her official Sven hat on, holding one of the pet chickens & glimpses of the chicken in commemoration of Svengoolie & Kerwyn Svengoolie’s big broadcast of Edgar G. Ulmer’s classic mammoth Universal horror masterpiece adaptation of “The Black Cat” (1942) with Boris Karloff and Bela Lugosi! Fellow super Svengoolie SvenPal/fellow super “Toon In With Me” Tooner Sarah Rhodes photographed moments of a pet chicken outdoors at Randy’s Farmers’ Market in Alvaredo, Texas; which was part of a Sat. morning live remote big broadcast at the Farmers’ Market via Sarah’s radio station, Waxahachie, Texas’ country & western (both kinds)! Musicradio station/the mighty KBEC-1390 AM/99.1 FM! Sarah also mentioned that the chicken was one of Kerwyn’s friends!

Congratulations to fellow super Svengoolie SvenPal/fellow super “Toon In With Me” Tooner/fellow super broadcaster/fellow super DJ Sarah Rhodes on your photo masterpieces of the pet chicken from Randy’s Farmers’ Market during the mighty KBEC Radio Sat. morning live remote big broadcast! Hope you & the entire KBEC big broadcast team all had a safe broadcast, Sarah! And a big, big toast to Sarah & all fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners everywhere on the wonderful congratulatory greetings for my “Toony & mini-Donut” cameo photo appearance in Toony & Bill’s “Toon In With Me” ep. #139 “mail call!” I highly appreciate the wonderful congratulatory “Toon In” cameo photo greetings, Sarah! Very awesome, neat & cool! We’re all jumping for joy for you! See you all for the live-tweeting of ep. #142 of Toony & Bill’s safety edition of “Toon In With Me” this Thurs. morning, Sarah & all fellow super SvenPals/all fellow super Tooners everywhere! Three cheers, two thumbs up, keep up the wonderful & excellent work, stay safe, keep healthy, stay well, peace, “Hi-Keeba” and a big, big toast to Sarah & all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere, all fellow super “Toon In with Me” Tooners everywhere, all fellow super broadcasters everywhere, all fellow super DJs everywhere, all fellow super artists everywhere, all fellow super photographers everywhere & the entire super big broadcast team of the mighty & legendary KBEC Radio, Sarah! –C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals & fellow super “ToonInWithMe” Tooners everywhere jumped for joy when one of our fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners recently created a Sven art creation masterpiece inspired by a recent visit to Berwyn, recent posts/praise/recent comments from all of us fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners in connection to a famous Berwyn bakery moments before Svengoolie’s big Me-TV broadcast of “The Black Cat” (1934)! Inspired by her recent visit to Berwyn near the Turano Bread building & comments/praise of Turano Bread from fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals/fellow super “Toon In With Me” Tooners Sarah Rhodes & myself, fellow super Svengoolie SvenPal/fellow super “Toon In With Me” Tooner Nanette Keir recently created a “Svengoolie”-style rendition/art creation masterpiece of the logo/mascot for Berwyn’s famous Turano Bread, featuring her digital art creation masterpiece rendition of Svengoolie/Rich Koz in place of the Turano baker/chef mascot/logo, as the Turano baker/chef mascot/logo has a slight resemblance to Svengoolie/Son of Svengoolie and with “Berwyn” in place of the “Turano” name in the logo!

Congratulations to fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals/fellow super “Toon In With Me” Tooners Nanette Keir & Sarah Rhodes on the “Sven”/”Turano”-style logo/art creation masterpiece! And a big, big toast to Nanette, Sarah & all fellow super SvenPals/fellow super Tooners everywhere on the wonderful congratulatory greetings for my “Toony & mini-Donut” cameo photo appearance in Toony & Bill’s “Toon In With Me” ep. #139 “mail call!” I highly appreciate the wonderful congratulatory “Toon In” cameo photo greetings, Nanette & Sarah! Very awesome, neat & cool! We’re all jumping for joy for all of you! See you all for the live-tweeting of ep. #142 of Toony & Bill’s safety edition of “Toon In With Me” this Thurs. morning, Nanette, Sarah & all fellow super SvenPals/all fellow super Tooners everywhere! Three cheers, two thumbs up, keep up the wonderful & excellent work, stay safe, keep healthy, stay well, peace, “Hi-Keeba” and a big, big toast to Sarah & all fellow super Svengoolie SvenPals everywhere, all fellow super “Toon In with Me” Tooners everywhere, Nanette & Sarah! –C.H.

Extra! Extra! Extra! Be sure to read fellow super Svengoolie SvenPal/fellow super “Jammin’ with Jamie” jammer Jamie Lee recently published her latest in-depth horror-comedy feature film article for 25YL’s horror entertainment blog site, Horror Obsessive on the recent announcement of a sequel to the classic modern Disney horror-comedy masterpiece, “Hocus Pocus” (1993) on Disney’s recent announcement of an upcoming sequel, “Hocus Pocus 2;” which will feature Bette Midler, Sarah Jessica Parker and Kathy Najimy reprising their roles as the Sanderson sisters! Nearly three decades after the original Disney theatrical release of “Hocus Pocus,” the upcoming sequel will be released through the studio’s exclusive premium streaming service platform, Disney+ around 2022- yet no month has been specified for next year’s premium streaming release.
